p:
Telaprevir. Telaprevir is an orally available inhibitor specific to the HCV nonstructural 3/4A serine protease.
197 It inhibits HCV replication by binding reversibly to nonstructural 3 serine protease. After oral administration, telaprevir achieves peak plasma concentrations in 4 to 5 hours. It is metabolized primarily in the liver and it has an elimination half-life of 4 to 5 hours. Most of the drug is excreted in the feces.
